subject: [R] R short course in UK
body:
We are announcing a short course, which is scheduled to take place in
June 2007 at The University of Reading, UK.  Summary information is given
below.  

For more detailed information and registration forms please see
http://www.ssc.rdg.ac.uk providing your address and/or fax number, or
email statistics-courses@lists.reading.ac.uk.

Statistical Modelling and Graphics using R
*******************************************
Dates: 6 - 7 June 2007.  Duration: 2 days.  Price: 585 GBP 

This course is aimed at statisticians, and other data analysts, who are
familiar with basic statistics and wish to learn to use R.

The course covers:  data structures, objects, classes, functions and basic
programming; exploratory data analysis using graphical methods; descriptive
methods, linear models, GLMs and an introduction to generalised additive
models (GAMs); more advanced graphics with R.  Although in two days you will
not become an R expert, the course aims to provide jumping off point from
which you can continue to learn using the "help" and web resources.
